tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
Dr Umesh Shety is very approachable doctor. Genuine advices shared and motivator.
Easy on pocket in terms of the fees. Best wishes to the doctor.
He knows his job and is expert. He explain to patients very nice and give clear information. He is thorough gentleman

No dought he is good doctor. His consultant fees we can consider but there's starting smallest procedure cost is 2000/- which is unreasonable under any grounds... Another thing is if patient has Mediclaim then according to rule of Mediclaim is we have to pay 10% of total expense of treatment under cashless system but they said we have to pay 10,000  deposit amounts because there is reimbursement system. According to me there is no true CASHLESS facility and REIMBURSEMENT system is not affordable for middle class people.. SO , this is my personal review. I am happy with doctor but not happy with unreasonable procedure cost and lack of real cashless facility...
Was hard to follow in explanation and treatment procedure wasnt clear.. diagnosis seemed incomplete and inconclusive

I visited Dr. Umesh Shetty because of the proximity to my location. However, my experience was disappointing ** ** ****** ******* **** **** ****** ** **** ********** ** ********* **** ********* Regardless of the nature of your ailment, you end up spending over ten thousand rupees because he exclusively prescribes medicines available only in his clinic. *** ****** ** *********** ********* ****** ** **** ** *** ******** ** ***** ******* *********** But when you research the prescribed medicines later, you realize they aren't even available online. ** ******* ** ** * ****** ** ******* ******** *** ********* ***** *** I strongly discourage anyone from seeing this doctor. *** ********* *** ***** ********** ************ **** ****

tags: Value for money,Treatment satisfaction,Explanation of the health issue,
review: Went for a minor issue. Turned out to be the most over priced visit. The doctor prescribed medicines (multivitamins etc) worth rs. 8,000. The pharmacy at this clinic ** **** **** ** ** ******** and billed us for 12K, and on careful investigation we reduced the dosage to what was prescribed and it was still 8K. This + doctor fee + physiotherapist at clinic, we ended up spending over 10K over a **** **** ***** issue **** ****** *** *** **** ** **** ************** ** **** **** ******* **** ******* *** ****** **** *****

Treatment was ok, but the doctor charged too much. Went for 3 consultations, each consultation he charged 600, 7000 to put the cast on... and 1500 to take it off. It was highway robbery. On top of that, the hospital was also not that great (Axis/Aviva hospital). The washroom didn't even have a working light and the pharmacy didn't have some of the medicines I needed, I had to buy them from another pharmacy. Treatment was ok, but not happy being ripped off. I had a lot of swelling, and it was a Sunday, and this was the only appointment I could get, so had no choice but to take the req treatment from Dr. Umesh. But very overpriced, and would not recommend to anyone.

tags: Wait time,Value for money,Treatment satisfaction,Explanation of the health issue,Doctor friendliness,
review: Waited 45 minutes as the Doctor was busy on a phone üì± call in his consultation room, I wondered then why did he give the appointment and the staff had no Guts to appraise him that patient is waiting for so long. Frustration and pain broke my patience and I started to leave the clinic and to utter surprise the staff didn't even bother to ask as to why I was going this *********** ** ****** **** * ** *** *** **** *** *** *** ****** **** ********** **********BUT I decided to write so others can know the truth that goes here.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: * ***** *** * ******** *** **** ***** **** ***** **** ********* **** *** ****  ********* ** ******* *** ****** ****** ** ******* *** ***** *** ***** ** ********* * *** ** ** ** ******* ****** *** ******* ** *********I had a hairline fracture in my finger . The doctor took the xray and put three injections of local anethesia in my finger and tried to fix my finger manually and put a pop dressing after that. ***** ** *** ***** ** ** *** ******** *** ******** ********* ** *** **** ** ******** *** ***** He charged me 5500 for this treatment *** **** *** ** ****** *** ***** *** ***** I had to visit another doctor which removed my xray and showed that the finger bone which had cracked was still in the same place. ** **** **** ** **** ***** *** ** **** *** **** *** *** *** ********** ******* **** ** ****** *** ********** ******** *** ******* ******* I would definetely want a complete refund. How can you even suggest **** doctors on your platform

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: The doctor will firstly not meet on committed time - atleast an hour delay. They will force you for physiotherapy for which there is additional charge which ia not informed by the doctor - *********** * *** **** ** ***** **** *** ** *** * ** ********* ******** ** *** ****** *** **** ***** *****

If an assistant takes the notes to save the time for the main doc, I do not have a problem with that. But if the assistant does half the diagnosis, tells me to get an X Ray without a deep understanding into the case, looks at the X Ray, directs me to the doctor, and as soon as I enter, just by watching me if he tells everything is alright? That is not the diagnosis I was expecting to pay for. After second opinion, I got to know the problem I had, which could have been taken care if this doctor spent time in analyzing the X Ray himself. I can jot down many more reasons, but to cut it short, he is not a doctor I would recommend to anyone.

My appointment was changed four times. First it was 11 am. Then 3 PM, then 3:30 PM and then 5:30 PM.  Not professional way.

Should appreciate other peoples time paeticularly when I communicated that patient is a senior citizen and she has experienced a fracture

tags: Treatment satisfaction,Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Wait time,
review: Dr Umesh Shetty is a very friendly doctor. Explained very well about the problem and it's healing process. He is a very patient Doctor. Gave good amount of time to listen. Thank you Doctor. My fracture healed up very quickly all thanks to the treatment given along with the medicines.

As much as the staff and doctor was fine I spent 10k only to get checked for some nerve compression ! And I can‚Äôt even tell what was the issue 
Will have to go and ask again 
5k we‚Äôre meds for a month and 5k consultations physiotherapy and X-rays- which they didn‚Äôt give me back
I will have to visit again and take them 
Even still it‚Äôs expensive as ji don‚Äôt have a major issue

What sort if doctor you are if you can‚Äôt respect your patient‚Äôs time? Waiting period of more than 1 hour shows how much you care about your patients. No point of taking of appointments because patients will still be waiting for hours and this doctor won‚Äôt reach his clinic at the committed time.

I really came to visit him just because of his experience; but i am highly disappointed by the way he talked to me and explained me. He didn address my problem properly, didn‚Äôt even ask me properly or told me what my problem is. And the most disappointing thing.. the moment i entered he was on a call for 10 mins **** ** ** ** * **** ***** ** * ******** and then he asks me yes what happened **** * **** **** *********** Felt weird and disappointed.

I consulted this doctor for injury to my leg. The reception was very cooperative and helpful. The doctor took my history and advised me x ray. It was done within few minutes and it was shown to the doctor. He explained and guided me properly. And did the procedure. The whole process was quick. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Doctor is experienced and too good at his work.

Pretty average experience.

Many of the staff don't wear mask. When I asked them for mask they said "we are vaccinated"üòïüò°

Reception was crowded, and noisy.

All records are on paper. By hand mostly. Nothing stored in system.

Doctor himself wasn't wearing a mask all the time during consultatation. He had tea cups on his table üòëüôÑ

Only one person (junior Doc Sadiq) was good, attentive and courteous.

So overall pretty average experience

For * ****** strapping of the little finger in the Right Foot with crepe I was charged 2000 Rs n this is apart from Rs 1000 that I paid for the Dr..'S Consultation******* **** *** **** **** **** ******** **** ** ******* *** ** **** **** *************so Extremely n Unreasonably Expensive....very Dissappointed with this Experience....would Not Recommended at all

Result-oriented. Cares for patient & tries to make treatment economical & affordable for patient. God bless him with success in his field & life.

I got an appointment for 12:30 pm as soon I reached there the guard told me doctor will come at 3:30 pm . I didn‚Äôt bother to listen to him and went to the hospital. The receptionist checked my appointment and asked me to wait for 2 mins . What is this behavior? Why did they even ask me to wait ? Huge disappointment!!! 
Please improve your services.

review:
I visited the doctor for a muscle pain. The doctor spent minimal time on addressing what the problem was and how to recover from it. But he was quick to prescribe 7 ** *** ******** medicines which are not available anywhere else other then their pharmacy. Also a bunch of in-house physiotherapy treatments. 
Also to add the in-house phisyo took only 1 min to ask me my issues and quickly pushed a ultrasound therapy for me..  this was the weirdest doctors appointment I have had.
*** ****** ******** **** *** ****** ** *** ********* *** **** ******* ** ******* ***** ********** ** *** ************* **** ** **** *** *****
Very unsatisfied. Never visiting this hospital again.
